description.narrative:
Economywide effects: The Project will restore the lost economic value of valuable PET resources through a circular economy of PET waste and create employment.
Stakeholder effects: The Project will increase PET recycling capacity in targeted emerging markets to meet the growing demand for recycling PET in food and beverage applications.
Environmental effects: The Project is expected to divert PET waste from land and marine environment through recycling. The Project is also expected to reduce Greenhouse Gas (GHG) intensity through replacing virgin PET with recycled PET, and implementation of other sustainability projects such resource efficiency and renewable energy.
Sustainability: The Project will promote a circular economy for PET bottles and catalyze the changes in the market by demonstrating innovative business models and best practices, and through capacity building.

The proposed investment is for up to US$150 million equivalent in A Loan and mobilization of up to US$150 million equivalent in Parallel loans to Indorama Ventures Global Services Limited (IVGS or the Company). IVGS, incorporated in Thailand is a subsidiary of Indorama Ventures Public Company Limited (IVL or the Group), is one of the worlds leading petrochemicals producers, with a global manufacturing footprint across Africa, Asia Pacific, Europe and Americas. The companys portfolio comprises Integrated PET, Olefins, Fibers, Packaging and Specialty Chemicals. IVL is a leading global producer of resins with integrated operations in the polyethylene terephthalate (PET) value chain.
